div.pre: 1899 Reggio, Bruttium, 1853 (854) Burial: 460-425 B.C. (K) Contents: AR. Pot hoard Rhegium Acragas Catana Messana Syracuse Athens Disposition: dispersed Pogwisch, BullInst 1853, p. 154 The only chronological clue is that the coins were "tutte bighe," by which is apparently meant the walking rather than the galloping quadriga. The presence of coins of Catana presumably implies a date of burial after the re- foundation in 461 B.C.
